sect2.title: Introduction to Cdrtools
sect2.para: The Cdrtools package contains CD recording utilities. These are useful for reading, creating or writing (burning) Compact Discs.

sect2.title: Installation of Cdrtools
sect2.para: Install Cdrtools by running the following commands:

userinput.command: make INS_BASE=/usr DEFINSUSR=root DEFINSGRP=root && make INS_BASE=/usr DEFINSUSR=root DEFINSGRP=root install

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: INS_BASE=/usr: This command moves the install directory from /opt/schily to /usr.
DEFINSUSR=root DEFINSGRP=root: These commands install all programs with root:root ownership instead of the default bin:bin.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Cdrtools package contains cdrecord, cdda2wav, mkisofs, mkhybrid, readcd, scgcheck, isoinfo, isodump, isovfy, isodebug, devdump, rscsi and support libraries.

sect3.title: cdrecord
sect3.para: cdrecord records audio or data Compact Discs.

sect3.title: cdda2wav
sect3.para: cdda2wav dumps Compact Disc audio into WAV sound files.

sect3.title: mkisofs
sect3.para: mkisofs and mkhybrid generate an ISO9660/JOLIET/HFS hybrid file system.

sect3.title: readcd
sect3.para: readcd reads or writes Compact Discs.

sect3.title: scgcheck
sect3.para: scgcheck is used to check and verify the Application Binary Interface of libscg.

sect3.title: support utilities
sect3.para: isoinfo, isodump, isovfy, isodebug and devdump are utility programs for dumping and verifying ISO9660 images.

sect3.title: rscsi
sect3.para: rscsi is a remote SCSI manager.

sect3.title: support libraries
sect3.para: libdeflt, libedc_ecc, libfile, libhfs, libparanoia, librscg, libscg, libschily and libunls are the support libraries for this package.
